title: Bride slams guest's 'petty' RSVP only to discover she died 3 days later
text:
"I am going to be petty as hell and send her a nasty a** letter back.”

Some of the most memorable moments of your life that's for sure!

Amy was so appalled by a guest’s response in their RSVP to her wedding that she took to Facebook to vent about it.

The good friend of her future mother in law didn’t hold back with what she was thinking in a handwritten note after she received her Save the Date.

“Kyle and Amy! What kind of invitation is this where I had to pay postage due to get your mail! The magnet was cracked as well. Arlene.”

Utterly gobsmacked, Amy starts off with explaining the situation about the postage.

“I went to the post office to verify the postage. The invite was under an ounce but since it was slightly thicker being a magnet they said use two ounce stamps which are 70 cents so I did.

People have been getting them all over, California, Arizona, Florida, Georgia with no issues.”

Want to join the family? Sign up to our Kidspot newsletter for more stories like this

Amy was so appalled by a guest’s response to her Save the Date. Source: Facebook

“What the f*** lady!"

Then the livid bride-to-be really unleashed…

“What the f*** lady. First of all, clearly that was not our intention. I put additional postage on it. People in Florida, Washington, Texas have gotten it with no additional postage needed,” she said.

“Second of all - you wasted an additional 55 cents to send that letter to us? Next time refuse the letter if you’re a** is going to b**** about $3.”

And Amy had no intentions of just leaving at it venting and moving on.

“So I am going to be petty as hell and send her a nasty a** letter back with a check in it for $3.51 to cover her postage, and hopefully she doesn't come to the wedding.”

Arlene complained about having to pay extra postage and then died a few days later. Source: Facebook

"HOW CRAZY IS THAT!!!!!”

However, the most tragic and unexpected thing happened just three days after she posted her outrage.

The 65-year-old woman, who had known her mother-in-law her entire life, passed away just three days later.

Updating her post, Amy wrote: “So I submitted this on September 22 (approved 30th) as of September 27th SHE DIED!!!!! HOW CRAZY IS THAT!!!!!”

And fellow group members were equally baffled by the outcome.

“I'm literally shocked at the update,” one said.

While another commented, “OMG what a turn of events.”
description: "I am going to be petty as hell and send her a nasty a** letter back.”
